text: I i know that i'm gay to some point like
when it finally clicked i figured out
you know what I've kind of always been
this way God was always what gave me
faith I mean I would pray to him about
my sexuality I would ask him you know
what what do you want what do you want
me to do here and he would give me the
confidence in the strength to really get
through whatever feelings I had I was
heavy with questions because I mean no
matter how strong your relationship is
with God I mean you still question well
I asked my dad do you think I'm going to
go to hell because I'm gay and I can
usually ask him questions about this
because he's pretty educated in the
Bible and he said you know what do you
believe that Jesus died on the cross for
your sins and I said yeah and he said do
you believe that you invited Jesus into
your heart and that you know your
Christian and I said I guess so yeah you
said well then that answers your
question for you you're going to heaven
and I really have faith in that
I passenger knows that I'm gay and their
church is really just about closeness
being together and being with the Lord
and I like that God does he knows who I
am because he created me and he created
me to be exactly who I am in every way
shape and form and that includes being
gay I have some really close best
friends who are Christians and we talk
about God and we talk about church and
then one of my friends who's really
supportive of me and she loves me she
her religion which is Christianity she
doesn't feel like she should support me
that much with being gay itself and she
knows that she can always be my friend
but she's not going to go to some gay
pride rally with me and I'm okay with
her accepting me and that's really all I
ever asked from her I don't want to have
myself being seen by people as oh she's
she's gay I want them to see me as well
she loves God who cares what kind of
people she likes she is a christian she
leads by example and she's a wonderful
person that's what I want people to
think when they see me
